docs.snippet: As of Sept. 30, personal watercraft will be prohibited in the 37 miles of the Delaware River that is part of the Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area. Following a series of public hearings, the parks service said personal watercraft like Je...
docs.lead_paragraph: As of Sept. 30, personal watercraft will be prohibited in the 37 miles of the Delaware River that is part of the Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area. Following a series of public hearings, the parks service said personal watercraft like Jet Skis or Wave Runners were disturbing to visitors who wanted a quiet, parklike setting. Karen DeMasters
docs.abstract: National Park Service, after series of public hearings, decides to ban Jet Skis and other personal watercraft in Delaware Water Gap National Recreational Area, effective September 30 (S)

docs.abstract: 3-judge Fed ct, 2-1, rules unconst secs of McCarran-Walter Immigration and Naturalization Act of '52, case of Belgian Marxist Dr E F Mandel; Govt rejected his visa application for US speaking tour in Oct and Nov, '69, on grounds he preached 'anarchistic' doctrines aimed at Forcible overthrow of Govt, ct majority backs right to 'free and open acad exchange'; Judge Bartels, in dissent, holds that his colleagues, while recognizing 'sovereign power to exclude in interest of self-preservation,' subordinated this to 1st Amendment guarantee of freedom of expression

headline.main: Court Upsets Federal Ban On Belgian Marxist's Visit; COURT UPSETS BAN ON MARXIST ALIEN

docs.snippet: Israeli security forces shot dead an 8-year-old Palestinian boy today when they opened fire on a crowd throwing stones in the West Bank city of Qalqilya, Palestinians said. Later, in Bethlehem, an Israeli soldier was killed by a Palestinian sniper...
docs.lead_paragraph: Israeli security forces shot dead an 8-year-old Palestinian boy today when they opened fire on a crowd throwing stones in the West Bank city of Qalqilya, Palestinians said. Later, in Bethlehem, an Israeli soldier was killed by a Palestinian sniper as he patrolled near Manger Square, the army said. The burst of violence came as the army shut Palestinians into their cities, saying warnings of planned terrorist attacks had forced it to rescind a promised easing of already strict travel restrictions during the Muslim holiday of Id al-Adha.
docs.abstract: Israeli soldiers open fire on stone-throwing crowd in Qalqilya in West Bank, killing eight-year-old boy; Israeli soldier is killed later by sniper while patrolling near Manger Square in Bethlehem; violence comes as army bans Palestinian travel because of terrorist threat, rescinding promise to lift ban for Muslim holiday; photos; map; soldiers intercept two would-be suicide bombers (M)

headline.main: Violence Follows a Ban on Palestinians' Holiday Travel
